content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.blu: Electricity, metal, wires, chemistry, circuitry, flesh, blood, a cryptic power — all twisted together to form… you. Broken. You came here from elsewhere or elsewhen, walking a one-way path toward oblivion, heralding the wretched godless truth. It’s merely a name they use for what they cannot understand, an excuse for the despair they have inflicted upon themselves and others, a tool to control others while blaming the so-called adversary. But you see through the veil — so, you must kill the very idea of it... Deicide or Gnosis?
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.ofA:
You have an internal or connected auxiliary power source that prevents you from starving (though, you still need to consume food and drink to restore HP or make use of your power source when resting), and some kind of mostly-useless neural interface or bionic brain, but you cannot use scrolls.

You are interfused with wires and bits of metal. This offers you protection (-d4 damage, tier 2). It may be repaired for twice the normal cost and twice that in pain. Wearing additional armor gives you Disadvantage on all physical tasks.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.vis: You cannot return to a vision a seer saw of their own death. The vision was a portal. And the vision was right — you killed them.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.gia: You cannot return to a world built upon and inside a comatose giant. When it awoke, you and your cursed kind fled to the stars.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.dys: You cannot return to a dystopian what-if of transhumanism and corporate wars. You left your humanity in 2020 — or maybe 2077.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.gal: You cannot return to a sixth future world of cybernetics and waking magic. A dragon sent you here from 2050 — or maybe 2082.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.meg: You cannot return to a long time ago in a distant galaxy. A wrong turn through hyper-space left you under twelve parsecs away.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.six: You cannot return to a megastructure that enveloped a star. Now you see what post-humans and bugs were like before the end.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.rai: You cannot return to a rainbow land not-so-secretly run by cats. You could not find others to join your caravan, so you came here.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.gri: You cannot return to a grimdark millennium contested by many factions. From violence and pessimism, you fight right in here.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.stu: d2 damage + test Toughness DR10+damage or Ability tests have Disadvantage for rounds equal to margin of failure; Δ12 charges.
d4 damage + test Toughness DR10+damage or Ability tests have Disadvantage for rounds equal to margin of failure; Δ12 charges.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.ele: Test Toughness DR14-armor/protection or Ability tests have Disadvantage for rounds equal to margin of failure; Δ10 charges.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.vib: d4+1 damage + Disadvantage to armor/protection; Δ10 charges.
d6+1 damage + Disadvantage to armor/protection; Δ8 charges.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.stu: d8 damage + test Toughness DR10+damage or or Ability tests have Disadvantage for rounds equal to margin of failure; Δ8 charges.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.las: Advantage to hit; 2d4 damage + Disadvantage to armor/protection; highly unstable, and it explodes on a fumble for 2d2 damage to all nearby creatures; Δ6 charges.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.bla: Advantage to hit; 2d6 damage + Disadvantage to armor/protection; highly unstable, and it explodes on a fumble for 2d4 damage to all nearby creatures; Δ6 charges.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.las: Advantage to hit; 2d8 damage + Disadvantage to armor/protection; highly unstable, and it explodes on a fumble for 2d6 damage to all nearby creatures; Δ4 charges.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.bla: Advantage to hit; 2d10 damage + Disadvantage to armor/protection; highly unstable, and it explodes on a fumble for 2d8 damage to all nearby creatures; Δ4 charges.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.for: 2d12 damage + Disadvantage to armor/protection; a crit severs a limb, and a fumble damages you as you sever one of your own limbs; passively uses your auxiliary power source.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.Δ.d:
This weapon uses an Energy Die (Δ). Roll after combat: on a 1–3, it lowers one step (Δ8 to Δ6 to Δ4 to Δ0, etc). A Δ4 or greater is required for the weapon to function.

After resting you may increase the Energy Die one step instead of recovering HP (but not beyond the original value).
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.bio: ({amount} doses, grants Advantage on one Ability test)
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.gra: mounted on/in your wrist with a thin-yet-durable cable
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.nig: in place of an eye (can be turned on/off at will)
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.rob: that sticks out of your back — it does not grant you an extra attack
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.mag: that shines brightly for {hours} hours before needing to recharge for half that time
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.aiA: embedded somewhere on your body. +2 to Presence tests when using equipment or data from your locally-stored download of the net
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.bio: provides biochemical information/medical diagnoses when pointed at a creature; transmitted directly to your brain
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.neo: Generate a field of fluorescent light around your body that functions as a shield and a torch for 2d6 minutes or until broken.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.mas: This symbiotic psyborg mask enables you to see the aura of a creature through it, allowing you to intuit its emotions — if a reaction roll would be made when meeting it, make it now, allowing you to know what the reaction of the creature would be ahead of time.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.exo: You must touch an object or a creature to teleport a small chunk of it away — a creature loses d4 HP, armor/protection is reduced by a tier, a weapon breaks, etc.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.unl: Discharge bluish-purple lightning from your hands with Advantage to hit for d8 damage + test Toughness DR10+damage or ability tests have Disadvantage for rounds equal to margin of failure.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.min: A creature that you can see loses the last Presence+5 minutes from its memory — though, you can choose to make the timeframe shorter.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.hyp: Step through the fourth dimension to completely disappear from the third dimension until your next turn, and you reappear anywhere you could’ve moved to in a single turn.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.psy: Using the power of your mind, grapple a creature that you can see as a ranged attack with Adv (but choose one roll to be a Strength test and the other to be a Presence test) — this continues until you let go or the creature escapes your grapple.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.ske: Through sheer power of willful disbelief, any Power used against you has Disadvantage (even if you are willing) until you rest or until a Power successfully affects you.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.pow:
Works like a standard Power but test Presence DR10. On a fumble, roll d6:
  1. 1. Suffer a nosebleed or pop a blood vessel. Lose an additional 1 HP.
  2. 2. You have Disadvantage on all Presence tests for the next hour or until you rest.
  3. 3. Gain 2d4+1 self-inflicted pstress (or, if not using the pstress mechanic, scream for d3 rounds, pass out for 4d6 minutes, and gain a new terrible trait).
  4. 4. Your Power works (though future uses still fail for an hour), and you suffer a hemorrhage as if broken.
  5. 5. Invoke a little more squick — d10 fingers turn into tentacles, d3 eyes appear on your body, d4 limbs are swollen and pulsating, etc.
  6. 6. All seems fine, but you have attracted the unwanted attention of some kind of psyborg, astral entity, Refvic being, or Elder Thing.
content.greysonwhy.psyberDevangelist.pst:
When you accumulate pstress ≥ your Presence+6, you have Disadvantage on any action taken against the creature(s) that pstressed you out — their true horror starts to sink in and warp your mind.
When you accumulate pstress equal to twice the sum of your Presence+6, roll d4:
  1. 1. Suffer a heart attack.
  2. 2. Fall into a coma.
  3. 3. Scream for d3 rounds, pass out for 4d6 minutes, and gain a new terrible trait.
  4. 4. Replace your Disadvantage with Advantage as your virtue momentarily shines through!
When you rest and unwind (and can restore HP) or when you experience one of the above effects, remove Toughness+6 pstress.
